snippet: Jason Rezaian, The Post’s Tehran correspondent who was detained in July without explanation, now faces at least two more months in prison, his brother said.
abstract: Judicial authorities in Iran extend by at least two months detention of Washington Post's Tehran correspondent Jason Rezaian, who has been imprisoned without explanation since July, kept in solitary confinement and denied access to a lawyer.
lead_paragraph: Jason Rezaian, The Post’s Tehran correspondent who was detained in July without explanation, now faces at least two more months in prison, his brother said.

headline.main: Iran Extends Imprisonment of Washington Post Reporter
headline.print_headline: Iran: Detention Is Extended for Washington Post Reporter

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
